label: Petition from Mary Anderson to the St. Andrew's Society
description: Petition of Mary Anderson to the St. Andrew's Society requesting assistance, explaining that her husband abandoned her when she was pregnant and she is now unable to support her infant.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Petition of Mary Anderson to the St. Andrew's Society requesting assistance, explaining that her husband abandoned her when she was pregnant and she is now unable to support her infant.

metadata.label: Access Note
metadata.value: For more information contact Special Collections, College of Charleston Libraries, 66 George St., Charleston SC 29401.

metadata.label: Digitization Specifications
metadata.value: 300 dpi, 24-bit depth, color. Epson Expression 10000XL. Archival masters are tiffs.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
with papers of 1768 [written in corner of paper in pencil at later date]

To the Honorable Gentlemen and Society of Saint Andrew -- 

Sheweth that your Petitioner Mary Anderson is a Native of Scotland and Came here with her Husband a Seaman who left me many months agoe [ago] at which time he left me in a deplorable Condition and big with Child since has been brought to Bed   therefore your Petitioner at this time want even of Common necessairies [necessaries] in Life with the poor Infant therefore under God your assistance will Save the life of the Innocent Babe and also your Petitioner having neither Victuals wood nor money to pay the midwife or Rent for the Room I live in and is threatened to be turned out for your human and Charitable good God of his Infinite Mercy reward you in Heaven for Saving two Lives this in the sincere prayers of your distressed Condition Labour under and for your so doing am bound with the life of my dear Infant forever to pay

Mary Anderson

metadata.value: St. Andrew's Society of Charleston Records, 1729-2001
